column5: Newslink: http://ottsun.canoe.ca/Sports/OtherSports/...497302-sun.html   Try ice-fishing licence-free this winter   What better time to give ice-fishing a try than at the first winter Ontario Family Fishing Weekend.  The Ontario Federation of Anglers and Hunters, in conjunction with the  Ontario government, are encouraging everyone to drop a line Feb. 24-25.  "Many Ontarians enjoy winter fishing as a  sport and social activity and parents and others across the province  can take this opportunity to introduce children and young adults to the  fun of fishing," said MNR Minister David Ramsay.  Canadian residents will be able to fish licence-free in any public waters across Ontario on Feb. 24-25.  The original concept for Ontario Family Fishing Weekend was presented by the OFAH.    During the family fishing weekend, anglers must continue to follow the  conservation licence limits set out in the 2005- 2006 Recreational  Fishing Regulations Summary.  For more information on the family  weekend, or if your organization would like to host an event, visit  www.familyfishingweekend.com
Wow, that will mean the ice will be busy that weekend!
No kidding! At least it will be super strong - for all those that don't know what they are doing or where they are going.
Perfect more for the Fishing for Tyler outing..  Thanks for posting
